template.name: Template SNMP Cisco BGP
template.description:
Works with BGP4-MIB and CISCO-BGP4-MIB files.
Use {$SNMP_COMMUNITY} macro.

discovery_rule.name: BGP peers discovery
discovery_rule.description: The rule will discover all BGP4 peers on router.

item_prototype.name: BGP peer {#SNMPINDEX} admin status
BGP peer {#SNMPINDEX} ASN
BGP peer {#SNMPINDEX} established time
BGP peer {#SNMPINDEX} IPv4 multicast prefixes accepted
item_prototype.description: Number of accepted route prefixes on this connection, which belong to an address family.

item_prototype.name: BGP peer {#SNMPINDEX} IPv4 multicast prefixes advertised
item_prototype.description: This counter is incremented when a route prefix, which belongs to an address family is advertised on this connection. It is initialized to zero when the connection is undergone a hard reset.

item_prototype.name: BGP peer {#SNMPINDEX} IPv4 multicast prefixes denied
item_prototype.description: This counter is incremented when a route prefix, which belongs to an address family, received on this connection is denied. It is initialized to zero when the connection is undergone a hard reset.

item_prototype.name: BGP peer {#SNMPINDEX} IPv4 multicast prefixes suppressed
item_prototype.description: This counter is incremented when a route prefix, which belongs to an address family is suppressed from being sent on this connection. It is initialized to zero when the connection is undergone a hard reset.

item_prototype.name: BGP peer {#SNMPINDEX} IPv4 multicast prefixes withdrawn
item_prototype.description: This counter is incremented when a route prefix, which belongs to an address family, is withdrawn on this connection. It is initialized to zero when the connection is undergone a hard reset.

item_prototype.name: BGP peer {#SNMPINDEX} IPv4 unicast prefixes accepted
item_prototype.description: Number of accepted route prefixes on this connection, which belong to an address family.

item_prototype.name: BGP peer {#SNMPINDEX} IPv4 unicast prefixes advertised
item_prototype.description: This counter is incremented when a route prefix, which belongs to an address family is advertised on this connection. It is initialized to zero when the connection is undergone a hard reset.

item_prototype.name: BGP peer {#SNMPINDEX} IPv4 unicast prefixes denied
item_prototype.description: This counter is incremented when a route prefix, which belongs to an address family, received on this connection is denied. It is initialized to zero when the connection is undergone a hard reset.

item_prototype.name: BGP peer {#SNMPINDEX} IPv4 unicast prefixes suppressed
item_prototype.description: This counter is incremented when a route prefix, which belongs to an address family is suppressed from being sent on this connection. It is initialized to zero when the connection is undergone a hard reset.

item_prototype.name: BGP peer {#SNMPINDEX} IPv4 unicast prefixes withdrawn
item_prototype.description: This counter is incremented when a route prefix, which belongs to an address family, is withdrawn on this connection. It is initialized to zero when the connection is undergone a hard reset.

item_prototype.name: BGP peer {#SNMPINDEX} IPv6 multicast prefixes accepted
item_prototype.description: Number of accepted route prefixes on this connection, which belong to an address family.

item_prototype.name: BGP peer {#SNMPINDEX} IPv6 multicast prefixes advertised
item_prototype.description: This counter is incremented when a route prefix, which belongs to an address family is advertised on this connection. It is initialized to zero when the connection is undergone a hard reset.

item_prototype.name: BGP peer {#SNMPINDEX} IPv6 multicast prefixes denied
item_prototype.description: This counter is incremented when a route prefix, which belongs to an address family, received on this connection is denied. It is initialized to zero when the connection is undergone a hard reset.

item_prototype.name: BGP peer {#SNMPINDEX} IPv6 multicast prefixes suppressed
item_prototype.description: This counter is incremented when a route prefix, which belongs to an address family is suppressed from being sent on this connection. It is initialized to zero when the connection is undergone a hard reset.

item_prototype.name: BGP peer {#SNMPINDEX} IPv6 multicast prefixes withdrawn
item_prototype.description: This counter is incremented when a route prefix, which belongs to an address family, is withdrawn on this connection. It is initialized to zero when the connection is undergone a hard reset.

item_prototype.name: BGP peer {#SNMPINDEX} IPv6 unicast prefixes accepted
item_prototype.description: Number of accepted route prefixes on this connection, which belong to an address family.

item_prototype.name: BGP peer {#SNMPINDEX} IPv6 unicast prefixes advertised
item_prototype.description: This counter is incremented when a route prefix, which belongs to an address family is advertised on this connection. It is initialized to zero when the connection is undergone a hard reset.

item_prototype.name: BGP peer {#SNMPINDEX} IPv6 unicast prefixes denied
item_prototype.description: This counter is incremented when a route prefix, which belongs to an address family, received on this connection is denied. It is initialized to zero when the connection is undergone a hard reset.

item_prototype.name: BGP peer {#SNMPINDEX} IPv6 unicast prefixes suppressed
item_prototype.description: This counter is incremented when a route prefix, which belongs to an address family is suppressed from being sent on this connection. It is initialized to zero when the connection is undergone a hard reset.

item_prototype.name: BGP peer {#SNMPINDEX} IPv6 unicast prefixes withdrawn
item_prototype.description: This counter is incremented when a route prefix, which belongs to an address family, is withdrawn on this connection. It is initialized to zero when the connection is undergone a hard reset.

item_prototype.name: BGP peer {#SNMPINDEX} peer state
BGP peer {#SNMPINDEX} remote address
BGP peer {#SNMPINDEX} VPNv4 prefixes accepted
item_prototype.description: Number of accepted route prefixes on this connection, which belong to an address family.

item_prototype.name: BGP peer {#SNMPINDEX} VPNv4 prefixes advertised
item_prototype.description: This counter is incremented when a route prefix, which belongs to an address family is advertised on this connection. It is initialized to zero when the connection is undergone a hard reset.

item_prototype.name: BGP peer {#SNMPINDEX} VPNv4 prefixes denied
item_prototype.description: This counter is incremented when a route prefix, which belongs to an address family, received on this connection is denied. It is initialized to zero when the connection is undergone a hard reset.

item_prototype.name: BGP peer {#SNMPINDEX} VPNv4 prefixes suppressed
item_prototype.description: This counter is incremented when a route prefix, which belongs to an address family is suppressed from being sent on this connection. It is initialized to zero when the connection is undergone a hard reset.

item_prototype.name: BGP peer {#SNMPINDEX} VPNv4 prefixes withdrawn
item_prototype.description: This counter is incremented when a route prefix, which belongs to an address family, is withdrawn on this connection. It is initialized to zero when the connection is undergone a hard reset.

item_prototype.name: BGP peer {#SNMPINDEX} VPNv6 prefixes accepted
item_prototype.description: Number of accepted route prefixes on this connection, which belong to an address family.

item_prototype.name: BGP peer {#SNMPINDEX} VPNv6 prefixes advertised
item_prototype.description: This counter is incremented when a route prefix, which belongs to an address family is advertised on this connection. It is initialized to zero when the connection is undergone a hard reset.

item_prototype.name: BGP peer {#SNMPINDEX} VPNv6 prefixes denied
item_prototype.description: This counter is incremented when a route prefix, which belongs to an address family, received on this connection is denied. It is initialized to zero when the connection is undergone a hard reset.

item_prototype.name: BGP peer {#SNMPINDEX} VPNv6 prefixes suppressed
item_prototype.description: This counter is incremented when a route prefix, which belongs to an address family is suppressed from being sent on this connection. It is initialized to zero when the connection is undergone a hard reset.

item_prototype.name: BGP peer {#SNMPINDEX} VPNv6 prefixes withdrawn
item_prototype.description: This counter is incremented when a route prefix, which belongs to an address family, is withdrawn on this connection. It is initialized to zero when the connection is undergone a hard reset.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerAdminStatus[{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=1 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerRemoteAddr[{#SNMPINDEX}].strlen()}>0 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerRemoteAs[{#SNMPINDEX}].strlen()}>0
trigger_prototype.name: BGP peer {ITEM.VALUE2} from ASN {ITEM.VALUE3} administratively down.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerState[{#SNMPINDEX}].last(0)}=6 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerRemoteAddr[{#SNMPINDEX}].strlen()}>0 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerRemoteAs[{#SNMPINDEX}].strlen()}>0 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:cbgpPeerAcceptedPrefixesIpv4Multicast[{#SNMPINDEX}].last(0)}<0.8*{Template SNMP Cisco BGP:cbgpPeerAcceptedPrefixesIpv4Multicast[{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(86400)}
trigger_prototype.name: BGP peer {ITEM.VALUE2} from ASN {ITEM.VALUE3} has lost more than 20% of IPv4 multicast prefixes on {HOST.NAME}

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerState[{#SNMPINDEX}].last(0)}=6 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerRemoteAddr[{#SNMPINDEX}].strlen()}>0 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerRemoteAs[{#SNMPINDEX}].strlen()}>0 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:cbgpPeerAcceptedPrefixesIpv4Unicast[{#SNMPINDEX}].last(0)}<0.8*{Template SNMP Cisco BGP:cbgpPeerAcceptedPrefixesIpv4Unicast[{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(86400)}
trigger_prototype.name: BGP peer {ITEM.VALUE2} from ASN {ITEM.VALUE3} has lost more than 20% of IPv4 unicast prefixes on {HOST.NAME}

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerState[{#SNMPINDEX}].last(0)}=6 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerRemoteAddr[{#SNMPINDEX}].strlen()}>0 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerRemoteAs[{#SNMPINDEX}].strlen()}>0 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:cbgpPeerAcceptedPrefixesIpv6Multicast[{#SNMPINDEX}].last(0)}<0.8*{Template SNMP Cisco BGP:cbgpPeerAcceptedPrefixesIpv6Multicast[{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(86400)}
trigger_prototype.name: BGP peer {ITEM.VALUE2} from ASN {ITEM.VALUE3} has lost more than 20% of IPv6 multicast prefixes on {HOST.NAME}

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerState[{#SNMPINDEX}].last(0)}=6 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerRemoteAddr[{#SNMPINDEX}].strlen()}>0 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerRemoteAs[{#SNMPINDEX}].strlen()}>0 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:cbgpPeerAcceptedPrefixesIpv6Unicast[{#SNMPINDEX}].last(0)}<0.8*{Template SNMP Cisco BGP:cbgpPeerAcceptedPrefixesIpv6Unicast[{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(86400)}
trigger_prototype.name: BGP peer {ITEM.VALUE2} from ASN {ITEM.VALUE3} has lost more than 20% of IPv6 unicast prefixes on {HOST.NAME}

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerState[{#SNMPINDEX}].last(0)}=6 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerRemoteAddr[{#SNMPINDEX}].strlen()}>0 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerRemoteAs[{#SNMPINDEX}].strlen()}>0 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:cbgpPeerAcceptedPrefixesVpnv4[{#SNMPINDEX}].last(0)}<0.8*{Template SNMP Cisco BGP:cbgpPeerAcceptedPrefixesVpnv4[{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(86400)}
trigger_prototype.name: BGP peer {ITEM.VALUE2} from ASN {ITEM.VALUE3} has lost more than 20% of VPNv4 prefixes on {HOST.NAME}

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerState[{#SNMPINDEX}].last(0)}=6 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerRemoteAddr[{#SNMPINDEX}].strlen()}>0 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerRemoteAs[{#SNMPINDEX}].strlen()}>0 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:cbgpPeerAcceptedPrefixesVpnv6[{#SNMPINDEX}].last(0)}<0.8*{Template SNMP Cisco BGP:cbgpPeerAcceptedPrefixesVpnv6[{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(86400)}
trigger_prototype.name: BGP peer {ITEM.VALUE2} from ASN {ITEM.VALUE3} has lost more than 20% of VPNv6 prefixes on {HOST.NAME}

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerState[{#SNMPINDEX}].last(0)}=6 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerRemoteAddr[{#SNMPINDEX}].strlen()}>0 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerRemoteAs[{#SNMPINDEX}].strlen()}>0 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:cbgpPeerAcceptedPrefixesIpv4Multicast[{#SNMPINDEX}].last(0)}=0
trigger_prototype.name: BGP peer {ITEM.VALUE2} from ASN {ITEM.VALUE3} has not received IPv4 multicast prefixes on {HOST.NAME}

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerState[{#SNMPINDEX}].last(0)}=6 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerRemoteAddr[{#SNMPINDEX}].strlen()}>0 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerRemoteAs[{#SNMPINDEX}].strlen()}>0 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:cbgpPeerAcceptedPrefixesIpv4Unicast[{#SNMPINDEX}].last(0)}=0
trigger_prototype.name: BGP peer {ITEM.VALUE2} from ASN {ITEM.VALUE3} has not received IPv4 unicast prefixes on {HOST.NAME}

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerState[{#SNMPINDEX}].last(0)}=6 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerRemoteAddr[{#SNMPINDEX}].strlen()}>0 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerRemoteAs[{#SNMPINDEX}].strlen()}>0 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:cbgpPeerAcceptedPrefixesIpv6Multicast[{#SNMPINDEX}].last(0)}=0
trigger_prototype.name: BGP peer {ITEM.VALUE2} from ASN {ITEM.VALUE3} has not received IPv6 multicast prefixes on {HOST.NAME}

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerState[{#SNMPINDEX}].last(0)}=6 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerRemoteAddr[{#SNMPINDEX}].strlen()}>0 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerRemoteAs[{#SNMPINDEX}].strlen()}>0 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:cbgpPeerAcceptedPrefixesIpv6Unicast[{#SNMPINDEX}].last(0)}=0
trigger_prototype.name: BGP peer {ITEM.VALUE2} from ASN {ITEM.VALUE3} has not received IPv6 unicast prefixes on {HOST.NAME}

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerState[{#SNMPINDEX}].last(0)}=6 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerRemoteAddr[{#SNMPINDEX}].strlen()}>0 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerRemoteAs[{#SNMPINDEX}].strlen()}>0 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:cbgpPeerAcceptedPrefixesVpnv4[{#SNMPINDEX}].last(0)}=0
trigger_prototype.name: BGP peer {ITEM.VALUE2} from ASN {ITEM.VALUE3} has not received VPNv4 prefixes on {HOST.NAME}

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerState[{#SNMPINDEX}].last(0)}=6 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerRemoteAddr[{#SNMPINDEX}].strlen()}>0 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerRemoteAs[{#SNMPINDEX}].strlen()}>0 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:cbgpPeerAcceptedPrefixesVpnv6[{#SNMPINDEX}].last(0)}=0
trigger_prototype.name: BGP peer {ITEM.VALUE2} from ASN {ITEM.VALUE3} has not received VPNv6 prefixes on {HOST.NAME}

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerState[{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}<>6 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerAdminStatus[{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=2 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerRemoteAddr[{#SNMPINDEX}].strlen()}>0 and {Template SNMP Cisco BGP:bgpPeerRemoteAs[{#SNMPINDEX}].strlen()}>0
trigger_prototype.name: BGP peer {ITEM.VALUE3} from ASN {ITEM.VALUE4} down and has state {ITEM.VALUE1}

graph_prototype.name: BGP informations for peer {#SNMPINDEX} in IPv4 multicast address-family
BGP informations for peer {#SNMPINDEX} in IPv4 unicast address-family
BGP informations for peer {#SNMPINDEX} in IPv6 multicast address-family
BGP informations for peer {#SNMPINDEX} in IPv6 unicast address-family
BGP informations for peer {#SNMPINDEX} in VPNv4 address-family
BGP informations for peer {#SNMPINDEX} in VPNv6 address-family
